questions.question_text: When you are running a vulnerability scan on a network and the IDS cuts off your connection, what type of IDS is being used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
EC Council Official Curricula
Computer Hacking Forensic Investigator
https://bookshelf.vitalsource.com/reader/books/9781635676969/

Module 9 page 943

Intrusion Detection System (IDS) 
An IDS is used to detect intrusions while an IPS is used to detect and prevent the intrusion on the network.

This question is awful, but from a LITERAL approach, this is Detection versus Prevention.
IDS is like a mall cop (observe and report). This is detection.
IPS is like law enforcement (take action). This is prevention.

Dropping a packet is taking action, and the only option with a "P" is (D. NIPS).
BUT the question asks which IDS...
I grudgingly choose (B. active IDS), but I strongly dislike this question.


-----
If you agree, please UPVOTE.
Each time you upvote someone with contributor access (like me) your vote is added to the Community Vote Distribution, which helps the entire community.

NIPS stands for Network-based Intrusion Prevention System. Unlike IDS, which detects and logs suspicious activities, NIPS can actively prevent malicious activities by taking actions such as blocking traffic, terminating connections, or reconfiguring firewall rules to stop attacks in real-time.
Watch out for this question. An IDS that drops the frame is called a NIPS.
B. An Active IDS is also known as Intrusion Detection and Prevention System (IDPS).

questions.question_text: Simon is a former employee of Trinitron XML Inc. He feels he was wrongly terminated and wants to hack into his former company's network. Since Simon remembers some of the server names, he attempts to run the axfr and ixfr commands using DIG. What is Simon trying to accomplish here?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
You can use different mechanisms for DNS zone transfer but the simplest one is AXFR (technically speaking, AXFR refers to the protocol used during a DNS zone transfer). It is a client-initiated request. Therefore, you can edit information on the primary DNS server and then use AXFR from the secondary DNS server to download the entire zone.

choices.A: Send DOS commands to crash the DNS servers
choices.D: Enumerate all the users in the domain

discussion.content:
A.

The SQL DROP TABLE statement is used to remove a table definition and all the data, indexes, triggers, constraints and permission specifications for that table

questions.question_text:
What will the following command produce on a website login page? SELECT email, passwd, login_id, full_name FROM members WHERE email =
'someone@somehwere.com'; DROP TABLE members; --'

choices.B: Inserts the Error! Reference source not found.email address into the members table
choices.D: This command will not produce anything since the syntax is incorrect
choices.C: Retrieves the password for the first user in the members table

discussion.content: SNMP uses both port 161 and port 162 for sending commands and messages.

questions.question_text: You setup SNMP in multiple offices of your company. Your SNMP software manager is not receiving data from other offices like it is for your main office. You suspect that firewall changes are to blame. What ports should you open for SNMP to work through Firewalls? (Choose two.)

You are carrying out the last round of testing for your new website before it goes live. The website has many dynamic pages and connects to a SQL backend that accesses your product inventory in a database. You come across a web security site that recommends inputting the following code into a search field on web pages to check for vulnerabilities: When you type this and click on search, you receive a pop-up window that says: "This is a test."
What is the result of this test?

comments.content:
Not sure it is a typo
CSS and XSS have the same meaning in that context and both mean "Cross Site Scripting". 
To not confuse with "CSS - Cascading Style Sheet", CSS is currently written XSS (X for cross).

discussion.content: We cannot see the input. Answer should be XSS. CSS is cascading style sheet. It is for styling HTLM pages.

choices.A: Your website is vulnerable to CSS
choices.D: Your website is vulnerable to web bugs
choices.C: Your website is vulnerable to SQL injection
